cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then turning north and northeast inland over Louisiana and Mississippi
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Port Fourchon/Grand Isle

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch/Warning east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA to AL/FL border; none west to Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City LA to Mouth of Pearl River; Tropical-Storm Warning Cameron LA to west of Intracoastal City LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from central Louisiana eastward to the Alabama/Florida border, with minor surge as far west as Sabine Pass TX
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤15%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusty squalls possible Sunday night into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft possible along Sabine Pass and the lower Sabine-Neches waterway; generally below major impact threshold
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–3 inches of rain; localized minor flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents on the upper Texas coast; otherwise no significant hazards expected for port operations
